alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 9:00AM EDT until June 26 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Franklin County in western Maine... Central Oxford County in western Maine... * Until noon EDT. * At 900 AM EDT, Trained weather spotters and Law Enforcement reported between 2 and 6 inches of rain has fallen and that flash flooding is occurring. For the most part, the rain has ended but runoff will continue for the rest of the morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rumford, Dixfield, Andover, Weld, Mexico, Grafton, Phillips, Carthage, Hanover and Byron. This includes the following Rec locations... Old Speck Mountain, Grafton Notch, Screw Auger Falls, Table Rock, Baldpate Mountain, Old Blue Mountain and Elephant Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
